text: (cheerful music)
- Hello,
I'm Daniel a cloud support engineer, here
at the AWS office, in Northern Virginia.
Today I'm going to show you how to use

source filters in your AWS
Database Migration tasks.
Lets get stadded.
As you can see, I've already logged in
to the AWS Management Console.

Next I will navigate
to the AWS DMS Console.
Create your task filtering.

Complete all necessary
fields, note, when you hover
on the I in a black circle for each field,

you will see more
information about the field.

In the table mapping
section select guided,
if you are comfortable with JSON
you can select the JSON tab,
and enter the mappings in JSON format.

Then select a schema
for instance DMS sample.
Table name is like seat,
can choose any table you want.
Action, include.

In the filter section choose,
add column filter link.
Column name is like seat number,
less then or equal to 5,000.

To add more filters,
click add condition link.
When done choose, save selection rule.

You can also add filter
conditions for an existing task.

When you're satisfied, choose
the create task button.
Select tasks from the navigation pane,
if the task is running first stop the task
then select modify.
I have a task that is running
I'll stop it.
Now you can see it's stopped
then select modify.
You can add a new selection rule
or edit an existing one
and add a filter.
And edit with this button,

when done, save the selection,
and click on modify.

Thanks for watching, and
happy cloud computing
from all of us here at AWS.
(cheerful music)
